title: Positive Tests in Uganda Olympic Delegation Challenge Protocols for Tokyo Games
sub_head: With the Olympics set to begin in a month, two arriving members of the Uganda delegation have tested positive despite vaccinations and pre-departure testing
body:
With the Tokyo Olympics set to open one month from now, the positive Covid-19 test of a second member of Uganda’s Olympic delegation upon arrival in Japan is revealing potential holes in plans to contain the virus during the Games.
One Ugandan coach—who had been vaccinated against the virus and tested negative before departure—arrived in Japan on Saturday and tested positive for the virus at Narita International Airport, the Ugandan Olympic Committee has said.
The coach, the Ugandan committee said, had received two doses of the AstraZeneca vaccine, and received negative results on PCR tests taken on two separate days 96 hours before a nine-member team left.  He was put into the care of Japanese officials, was asymptomatic and “doing fine,” the Ugandan committee said in a press release.
The rest of the team, which had also been vaccinated, received negative test results at the airport and continued to their pre-Olympic preparation camp in Izumisano, Osaka, according to the Ugandan committee, where they then settled in to begin their training.
Izumisano City said they had determined that the eight other athletes and officials who had traveled with the coach, as well as one Izumisano City employee who traveled with the team from Uganda to Japan, should be considered close contacts and tested daily for the virus.
